API Reference

This page contains the API reference for the radiosonde-teamxuk package.

Modules

  • radiosonde_teamxuk.process_radiosondes

  • radiosonde_teamxuk.generate_quicklooks

radiosonde_teamxuk.process_radiosondes

Module for processing radiosonde data from EDT format to NCAS-AMOF NetCDF format.

Process radiosonde files from TEAMxUK campaign Usage: python process_radiosondes.py <input_directory> <output_directory>

radiosonde_teamxuk.process_radiosondes.wind_components(speed, direction)[source]

Calculate u and v wind components from speed and direction

Parameters:

speedarray-like

Wind speed in m/s

directionarray-like

Wind direction in degrees (meteorological convention)

Returns:

: u, v : tuple of arrays

u (east-west) and v (north-south) components

radiosonde_teamxuk.process_radiosondes.read_rs41_bufr(filename)[source]

Read RS41-SGP radiosonde data from BUFR file

Parameters:

filenamestr

Path to BUFR file

Returns:

: list of dict

List containing profile dictionary with atmospheric data

radiosonde_teamxuk.process_radiosondes.read_edt_file(filename)[source]

Read Vaisala EDT (Extended Data) file

Parameters:

filenamestr

Path to EDT file

Returns:

: list of dict

List containing profile dictionary with atmospheric data

radiosonde_teamxuk.process_radiosondes.save_to_ncas_netcdf(profile, output_dir, instrument=None, metadata_dir=None)[source]

Save radiosonde profile data to NCAS-AMOF NetCDF format

Parameters:

profiledict

Dictionary containing radiosonde data

output_dirstr

Directory where output NetCDF file will be saved (uses NCAS naming convention)

instrumentstr, optional

Instrument identifier. If None, determined from hardware_version in profile (0x70 -> ncas-radiosonde-1, 0x60 -> ncas-radiosonde-2, default: ncas-radiosonde-2)

metadata_dirstr, optional

Directory containing instrument-specific metadata files (metadata_ncas-radiosonde-1.json and metadata_ncas-radiosonde-2.json)

radiosonde_teamxuk.process_radiosondes.plot_combined_analysis(profiles, filename=None)[source]

Combined plot: Skew-T on left, hodograph and map stacked on right

Parameters:

profileslist

List of radiosonde profiles

filenamestr, optional

Name of the source file to display in plot

radiosonde_teamxuk.process_radiosondes.process_edt_files(input_dir, output_dir, metadata_dir=None)[source]

Process all EDT files in input directory and save NetCDF files to output directory

Parameters:

input_dirstr

Directory containing EDT files

output_dirstr

Directory to save output NetCDF files

metadata_dirstr, optional

Directory containing instrument-specific metadata files for NetCDF generation

radiosonde_teamxuk.process_radiosondes.main()[source]

Main entry point for script

radiosonde_teamxuk.generate_quicklooks

Module for generating quicklook visualization plots from radiosonde NetCDF files.

Generate quicklook plots from NetCDF radiosonde files Usage: python generate_quicklooks.py <input_directory> <output_directory>

radiosonde_teamxuk.generate_quicklooks.wind_components(speed, direction)[source]

Calculate u and v wind components from speed and direction

Parameters:

speedarray-like

Wind speed in m/s

directionarray-like

Wind direction in degrees (meteorological convention)

Returns:

: u, v : tuple of arrays

u (east-west) and v (north-south) components

radiosonde_teamxuk.generate_quicklooks.read_netcdf_profile(nc_file)[source]

Read radiosonde profile from NetCDF file

Parameters:

nc_filestr

Path to NetCDF file

Returns:

: dict

Profile dictionary with atmospheric data

radiosonde_teamxuk.generate_quicklooks.plot_combined_analysis(profile, filename=None, map_extent=None, max_altitude=None, show_stability=False)[source]

Combined plot: Skew-T on left, hodograph and map stacked on right

Parameters:

profiledict

Radiosonde profile dictionary

filenamestr, optional

Name of the source file to display in plot

map_extentlist, optional

Map extent [lon_min, lon_max, lat_min, lat_max] for consistent bounds

max_altitudefloat, optional

Maximum altitude across all flights for consistent colormap scaling

show_stabilitybool, optional

If True, display CAPE/CIN shading and LCL/LFC markers (default: False)

radiosonde_teamxuk.generate_quicklooks.compute_overall_bounds(nc_files)[source]

Compute overall geospatial bounds and maximum altitude from all NetCDF files

Parameters:

nc_fileslist

List of NetCDF file paths

Returns:

: tuple

(map_extent, max_altitude) where map_extent is [lon_min, lon_max, lat_min, lat_max] or (None, None) if no valid data

radiosonde_teamxuk.generate_quicklooks.process_netcdf_files(input_dir, output_dir=None, show_stability=False)[source]

Process all NetCDF files in input directory tree and generate quicklook plots

Searches recursively for NetCDF files in subdirectories (e.g., instrument/project/YYYY/MM/) and saves quicklooks to quicklooks directories at the instrument/project level.

Parameters:

input_dirstr

Root directory containing NetCDF files (searches recursively)

output_dirstr, optional

Not used - kept for backwards compatibility

show_stabilitybool, optional

If True, display CAPE/CIN shading and LCL/LFC markers (default: False)

radiosonde_teamxuk.generate_quicklooks.main()[source]

Main entry point for script
